channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Honduras Moves to Extradite Man Accused of Killing Iowa Woman
item.description: In his 2016 campaign, President Trump seized on the death of Sarah Root, who police said was killed by an undocumented immigrant suspected of driving ...

item.title: US to deploy nearly 3,000 additional troops to southern border
item.description: The additional troops will bring the total number of active-duty personnel there to around 9,000, the US military said Saturday.

item.title: Hundreds Gather at National Parks Across U.S. to Protest Job Cuts
item.description: From Acadia in Maine to Joshua Tree in Southern California, protesters turned out to stand up against what they see as threats to public lands.

item.title: Trump Signs Order to Designate English as Official Language of the U.S.
item.description: The order did not require changes to federal programs but was a victory for America’s English-only movement, which has ties to efforts to restrict imm...

item.title: Thousands report outage affecting Microsoft services like Outlook
item.description: “We’ve identified a potential cause of impact and have reverted the suspected code to alleviate impact,” Microsoft said.

item.title: Mystery of Gene Hackman’s Death Brings Grief and Bewilderment to Santa Fe
item.description: Residents mourning Mr. Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, are consumed by the unusual circumstances surrounding their deaths and why they were not d...

item.title: Wildfires in the Carolinas Prompt Evacuations
item.description: Gusty winds combined with dry air and unusually high temperatures were fueling the rapid spread of fires on Saturday.

item.title: China is ‘in a sweet spot’ as Trump’s shift away from allies deprives him of leverage over Beijing, analyst says
item.description: "Instead what we see, in the first month and a half of this new administration, the conflict is between the U.S. and its allies."

item.title: Gazans Mark a Somber Ramadan Amid the Rubble
item.description: “This Ramadan is nothing like the ones before,” said one resident as the holy fasting month for Muslims began. “The war has drained it of meaning.”

item.title: Sovereign wealth funds are back in vogue as ‘an extension of a country’s industrial policy’
item.description: Indonesia, the Philippines and the city of Hong Kong all recently launched new funds. Now Trump's U.S. wants one too.

item.title: Angie Stone, Hip-Hop Pioneer Turned Neo-Soul Singer, Dies at 63
item.description: After having success as a member of the Sequence, an early female rap group, she re-emerged in the 1990s as a practitioner of sultry, laid-back R&B.

item.title: The US economy has suddenly been thrown into reverse as key GDP indicator flashes stunning negative forecast
item.description: The Atlanta Fed's GDP tracker now indicates the economy is headed for a 1.5% contraction in the first quarter, after showing 2.3% growth just days ear...

item.title: Lawsuit Against Panama Challenges Detention of Trump Deportees
item.description: A group of lawyers accused Panama of violating the rights of people deported from the United States under the Trump administration’s policy of sending...

item.title: Illegal Migration to the U.S. Now People Are Heading to Canada.
item.description: The Canadian government has reinforced border operations to stop migrants going to the United States, a major Trump complaint. But early data shows pe...

item.title: Welcome to the Zero Sum Era. Now How Do We Get Out?
item.description: Zero-sum thinking has spread like a mind virus, from geopolitics to pop culture.
